definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
younger brother/junior male/I (modest word in letter)

sentences.english: He is a lewd of a dandy, but admits skill, shrewd.
sentences.chinese: 他固然是个好色的纨绔子弟，但身手矫捷，精明能干。

sentences.english: A few fops came out of the teahouse.
sentences.chinese: 从茶馆里走出几个纨绔子弟。

sentences.english: John has a rputation for bing a man about town.
sentences.chinese: 约翰被人们以为是一个纨绔子弟。

sentences.english: John has a reputation for being a man about town.
sentences.chinese: 约翰被人们认为是一个纨绔子弟。

definition: pampered son of a wealthy family
without learning or skills (idiom); ignorant and incompetent
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
children of officials/word created by analogy with 富二代[fu4 er4 dai4]
to spend one's time in drinking and pleasure (idiom); to indulge in sensual pleasures/life of debauchery
wine sack, food bag (idiom); useless person, only fit for guzzling and boozing
to go dining, wining, whoring and gambling/to lead a life of dissipation
a pack of rogues (idiom); a gang of scoundrels
